item.title: Tarjan's Algorithm
item.description: A directed graph exhibits strong connectivity when every pair of vertices is connected by a path. A strongly connected component (SCC) within such a graph is a largest subgraph where every vertex is reachable from every other vertex. For instance, in the given graph, there are three SCCs. Algorithm: Tarjan’s algorithm utilizes DFS (Depth First Search) traversal. It maintains three arrays: disc[] to store discovery time of vertices, low[] to store the earliest visited vertex reachable from subtree rooted with current vertex, and stackMember[] to keep track of vertices present in the stack.
